text:
Inland Fisheries (Declared Freshwater Fish) Order 2009

I make the following order under section 4(1)(b) of the Inland Fisheries Act 1995 with the agreement of the Minister responsible for the administration of the Living Marine Resources Management Act 1995 .

26 May 2009

D. E. LLEWELLYN

Minister for Primary Industries and Water

1. Short title
    This order may be cited as the Inland Fisheries (Declared Freshwater Fish) Order 2009 .

2. Commencement
    This order takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.

3. Declared freshwater fish
    The following kinds or species of freshwater fish are declared not to be freshwater fish for the purposes of the Inland Fisheries Act 1995 during any time they are in, or after they have been taken from, State waters:
            (a) Atlantic salmon (Salmo salar);
            (b) Brook trout (Salvelinus fontinalis);
            (c) Rainbow trout (Oncorhynchus mykiss).

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 10 June 2009

This order is administered in the Department of Primary Industries and Water.
